title: 3 bedroom terraced house for rent
furnish_type: Furnished or unfurnished, landlord is flexible
description: Tucked into the streets of Hillgate Village, this townhouse captures the rare Notting Hill duality: village calm with the city close at hand. Brick-fronted and traditional in form, it opens to interiors that favour restraint, texture and considered detail throughout. <PARA> The ground floor unfolds into a double reception room, naturally zoned beneath generous ceiling heights. West-facing sash windows draw in afternoon light, illuminating warm neutral walls and an exposed brick fireplace that anchors the dining area with rustic charm. Beyond, a relaxed sitting space centres around an olive-toned sofa and earthy textures. <PARA> At the rear, the home opens into its defining space: an open-plan kitchen designed for everyday living. Light wooden floors run underfoot, while shaker cabinetry, a wooden island and French doors keep tradition in mind – the latter of which leads to a small patio garden. Overhead, a contemporary skylight introduces a modern counterpoint. Upstairs, a flexible social space – currently styled as a reception room – offers versatility to serve as a bedroom or home office. <PARA> Above, the principal suite occupies the second floor, where south-west facing windows and built-in wardrobes create a calm, uncluttered retreat. A second bedroom sits alongside, both served by a refined shower room finished with zellige tiles and a dual vanity. One further bedroom is found on the floor below, accompanied by a sleek family bathroom. <PARA> The home further benefits from a roof terrace – an ideal backdrop for London’s summer season. <PARA> Location <PARA> Hillgate Village possesses a quiet character with its quaint cafés and eclectic eateries. On your doorstep, explore a vibrant street of pastel façades and community-minded spots. Start the day with brunch from Eggbreak, then it’s less than ten minutes’ walk to Portobello Road. Wander through stalls and vintage shops, stopping at Gold to enjoy seasonal small plates. A more refined selection of stores awaits at High Street Kensington. Come evening, dining options are just moments from your door. Greek food is in plentiful supply – discover a menu designed for sharing at Mediterranean bistro Suzi Tros or try the signature dishes at Mazi. For refined Japanese flavours, head to Juno Omakase. Complete the day with a drink at The Hillgate – a charming family-run gastropub with a crackling fire. <PARA> Notting Hill Gate - 2 mins (Circle, District, Central) <PARA> Holland Park -10 mins (Central)
features: Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea

title: 2 bedroom apartment for rent
description: Moments from one of the area’s liveliest streets this second-floor apartment feels calm and expansive. Defining features preserve the home’s period heritage, from oak floors to cornicing-trimmed ceilings and soaring windows. <PARA> The open-plan reception and dining room is a showcase of light: a run of sash windows and French doors opens onto two private balconies overlooking leafy surroundings. Ornate fireplaces sit at either end of the space, anchoring a room destined for entertaining, while cast-iron radiators and intricate cornicing reveal a sense of craftmanship. Double doors draw the eye through to the kitchen, where integrated appliances and streamlined, handleless cabinetry create a contemporary scene. A sash window ensures the room remains bright throughout the day, and a discreet door offers direct access to the lift. <PARA> A second doorway from the reception leads to the sleeping quarters. The principal suite occupies the quiet rear of the apartment, complete with built-in wardrobes, a large cast-iron radiator and an elegant bathroom featuring a tiled bath, separate shower and twin basins. The guest bedroom suite mirrors the home’s understated feel, enjoying its own bathroom and tranquil views across the gardens. <PARA> *Images feature CGI staging and are for illustrative purposes only – this property comes unfurnished. <PARA> On a handsome street 15 minutes’ walk from Hyde Park, this eye-catching apartment is close to some of London’s best attractions and restaurants. For culture, choose between the V&A Museum and the world-famous Royal Albert Hall. Local Michelin-starred restaurants are also within strolling distance – try Amaya for refined Indian cuisine or Dinner by Heston Blumenthal for molecular gastronomy. Alternatively, spend the evening at Dinings SW3 before enjoying a nightcap at The Wilton Arms. <PARA> South Kensington - 8 mins (Circle & District, Piccadilly) <PARA>

title: 3 bedroom terraced house for rent
description: A Reimagined Period House on Pavilion Road, Knightsbridge <PARA> Set on the charming Pavilion Road, this beautifully reimagined house unfolds across three considered floors, blending the original features of a period building with contemporary design. Recently refurbished throughout, the interiors feel calm and assured, shaped by high ceilings, pale timber floors and a thoughtful openness that allows light to travel from front to back. <PARA> The ground floor is given over to living and entertaining, arranged as two interconnected reception spaces. At the rear, an expansive kitchen, dining and sitting room forms the heart of the house, with clean modern cabinetry, integrated appliances and generous proportions suited to everyday life as much as larger gatherings. To the front, a second reception room offers a quieter counterpoint, perfect as a study, media room or more intimate sitting area. Glazed doors open onto a neat terrace, extending the living space in warmer months. <PARA> Two well-balanced ensuite bedrooms occupy the first floor, each with built-in storage. The upper level is reserved for the principal suite, a generous and private space with a dressing room and a large bathroom illuminated by rooflights. Throughout, the house has been finished with a confident, contemporary hand, with air-conditioning, modern joinery and understated detailing lending a turnkey ease. <PARA> Pavilion Road has evolved into one of Knightsbridge's most appealing addresses, a village-like enclave of independent cafés, bakeries and small boutiques set between Sloane Street and Brompton Road. Hyde Park is a short walk away, as are the museums of South Kensington, while Harrods and Harvey Nichols sit close by for more established indulgences. Excellent transport links at Knightsbridge and Sloane Square connect effortlessly with the rest of London, yet the street itself retains a sense of neighbourhood calm that feels increasingly rare in the centre of the city.
